message_1: What is the efficiency of a nuclear power plant that generates 1800 MW of electrical power if it consumes 2000 MW of thermal power?
message_2:
The efficiency of a power plant can be calculated using the following formula:

Efficiency = (Output Power / Input Power) × 100%

In this case, the output power is the electrical power generated (1800 MW) and the input power is the thermal power consumed (2000 MW).

Efficiency = (1800 MW / 2000 MW) × 100%

Efficiency = 0.9 × 100%

Efficiency = 90%

So, the efficiency of the nuclear power plant is 90%.
